definition: to back sb up/to support sb in an argument/(lit. to beat nearby drum)
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
suffix of a noun of locality
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]

sentences.english: Wang Shuo only comments from the side.
sentences.chinese: 王朔只是在侧敲边鼓提意见。

sentences.english: Three Cheers for an American Empire?

definition: to echo what sb said/to back sb up from the sidelines (in an argument)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
to urge sb on
to play deaf-mute
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to be a drag or hindrance on sb
to be more of a hindrance than a help
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
to take the lead/to be first to (do sth)/to pioneer
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
